revised_title: Plastic Deformation Processes in Silicon Iron: Orientation and Temperature Dependence
tldr: This study investigates the orientation and temperature dependence of plastic deformation processes in 3-25% silicon iron. The authors found that slip bands form and grow with increasing strain, and that slip occurs on multiple crystallographic planes. At higher temperatures, slip bands are less well-defined. The results have implications for understanding the mechanical behavior of silicon iron and other materials.
scientific_discipline: Materials Science > Crystallography and Deformation Mechanisms
